scenes.scene_data: Godot VN Demo, press the >>> button at the right bottom to proceed.
Welcome to the godot VN demonstration
This will show you how to make visual novels in godot.
Every page displays some content.
The player can move either backward and forward trough the buttons or with the keyboard.
As with all visual novels it will display a text and a background image.
In addition a background sound can be played.
Background images and sounds will remain until changed on a new page.
Text will be displayed per page once.
Likewise a once to be played sound can be specified per page that will stop instantly on next page.
Custom fonts with color and size values can also be specified and will be in effect until changed.

scene_data.text: Image items may also be placed in the foreground at any spots.

scenes.scene_data: These will remain in effect until cleared either by a new possibly emtpy set.

scene_data.text: Or until a new background picture will be used.
Choices may also be displayed to affect the game.

scenes.scene_data: You have picked A.
You have picked B.
Choices can jump to a certain page.
If you pressed A, you will have seen a and skipped B, and the other way around too.
These pages need to be marked with a page id.
This is for now all the capablitiy that godot vn offers.
Now lets come to actually making a game.
A editor is provided accessable from the main menu.
Which provides all the functionality from a simple graphical user interface.
All files used must be inside the godot vn folder.
Images and sounds you have to find/make yourselfs.
The actual page data is saved in a filed called data.xml
You can also edit it by hand if you want, its not so hard to do.
Well, that is all there is to it.
Remember this is still in development so keep an eye out for updates.
Have fun using godot vn.
